title: Happy Birthday
description: Learn to play the world's most famous song, line by line.

steps.title: Happy Birthday
steps.description: This universally known melody is actually trickier than it sounds! It starts on the 5th (G) below the root and uses a wider range than most beginner songs. We'll learn it in the key of C major.

steps.title: Line 1: "Happy birthday to you"
steps.description: Play: G G A G C B. Start below middle C.
steps.hint: Start on G3 (MIDI 55), one octave below the G above middle C.

steps.title: Line 2: "Happy birthday to you"
steps.description: Play: G G A G D C. Almost the same but ends differently.
steps.hint: Same start, but this time go up to D then C.

steps.title: Line 3: "Happy birthday dear..."
steps.description: Play: G G (high G) E C B A. This is the climax!
steps.hint: The big jump to high G (MIDI 67) is the dramatic moment.

steps.title: Line 4: "Happy birthday to you"
steps.description: Play: F F E C D C. The final resolution.
steps.hint: Walk down from F to C, then up to D and back to C.

steps.title: Chord: C Major
steps.description: The song starts and ends on C major.

steps.title: Chord: G Major
steps.description: Line 2 ends on a G chord before resolving back to C.

steps.title: Full Song Checkpoint
steps.description: Play the full melody from start to finish: G G A G C B | G G A G D C | G G G E C B A | F F E C D C.
steps.hint: Focus on smooth transitions between lines, especially the jump to high G.

steps.title: Review Quiz
steps.description: Which chord progression is most central to this lesson?

steps.title: You Did It!
steps.description: You can now play Happy Birthday on piano! This song uses the I (C), IV (F), and V (G) chords â€” the same three-chord foundation as hundreds of popular songs. Try putting the melody and chords together.
